intro: Myrmechila trapeziformis, commonly known as the trapezoid leaf stink bug, is a species of plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive trapezoidal-shaped leaves and is native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually dark green and have a rough texture, while its flowers are small and clustered. The plant is known for its strong, unpleasant odor when crushed, which serves as a defense mechanism against herbivores.
